technical decision that becomes a liability for you to innovate that is
the definition of technical debt and if you think about it that way I see
startups who generate brand new services using all the buzzwords serverless computing micro services based
architectures in a DevOps environment and they accumulate tech debt straight away because just because you're using
the fun shiny new technologies doesn't mean you're making the right decisions and if you have bad api's you have
